Key Match Events: The Red Sox fell behind, 1-0, in the second inning with Brayan Bello on the mound. But a Ceddanne Rafaela triple off New York starter Luis Severino that snuck under the glove of a diving, overly aggressive Brandon Nimmo in center, backed by a Jarren Duran RBI single, quickly tied the game in the third.
In the bottom half, Francisco Lindor reached on a single and Nimmo laced a ball to Duran in center. Duran came in, but the ball sailed over his head. Lindor scored for a 2-1 lead.

In the fourth, Connor Wong dropped a Jeff McNeil foul ball. Although Bello retired McNeil via strikeout and induced a Starling Marte ground out, the next batter, DJ Stewart, kept the frame alive with a two-out single.

Luis Torrens then tagged a Bello offering to left. The ball landed down the line near Tyler O’Neill, who appeared as though he had a play, but coasted to the spot. O’Neill tried to backhand the ball on a hop, but it deflected off his glove. Stewart scored from first on the error.
Lindor then delivered the final blow in that inning with an RBI single.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox have lost their last three, eight of their last 11, and are 13-17 since Aug. 1.

The Twins beat the Rays, 5-4, to move ahead of the Royals in the standings. Despite Kansas City’s six-game losing streak, including Monday’s 4-2 loss to the Guardians, the Sox are still 4½ games behind the final wild-card spot.
Others: The game was played at Citi Field.
The Red Sox faced New York starter Luis Severino.
Brayan Bello started for the Red Sox.
Ceddanne Rafaela tripled in the game.
Jarren Duran had an RBI single in the game.
Francisco Lindor had a single and an RBI in the game.
Jeff McNeil had a single in the game.
Starling Marte had a ground out in the game.
DJ Stewart had a single and scored a run in the game.
Luis Torrens had a single in the game.
Tyler O’Neill had an error in the game.
Triston Casas scooped the throw at first to get the Mets' Pete Alonso in the first inning at Citi Field.
